title: Should Zoe only be able to get utility drops?

It's controversial because she gets free actives in summoner spells that she didn't take or items that she didn't buy. That's gamebreaking in the most literal sense.
But she doesn't have an ability to cover for it.

>But she doesn't have an ability to cover for it.

her W passive already does more than {{champion:103}} W active imao

also zoe's passive it's like a 4th active ability that you proc wtih autos
Redemption is such a powerful drop.  Throw it top or bot for an instant huge lane advantage.

Maybe there should be a cooldown on her W to make it fairer? In ARAM, if Zoe picks up two snowballs, there's a two-minute cooldown on the second W cast. I'm not saying make it two minutes, maybe one-minute cooldown since waves spawn ever thirty seconds and you're pretty much guaranteed to get a summoner/active drop per wave. This way she can still use her W if she picks up a summoner/active, but she can't just pick up 4 flashes and 3 ignites in a teamfight and run over people with their summoners/actives.
RNG is unhealthy and has no place in a competitive game.  Delete her from League.

Well you're in luck, 'cause all the stats say she's B-tier. Implying that her high banrate is out of unnecessary fear rather than any actual basis in the facts.
Crit and Klepto are fine though?

I don't like the idea of "Zoe can get any Summoner Spell/Item in the game!... Except for: (lists all the damage stuff)".

Kinda ruins the whole concept of being able to pick up anything.

I think the best course of action is enforcing a "use the stuff you just picked up immediately" thing, rather than "pick it up and use it when you feel like it", and enforcing a "if you want to deal damage with this, you actually have to stay close to the target" so she can't just sit on an Ignite and you can't trade with her for the next minute and she can't jump in, quickly deal damage and then jump out.

So kinda like:

**Cooldown removed. Now costs 50 mana to use.**

**Enemy lock-on range decreased to 500 from 550.**

**ALL Spell shards on the ground durations decreased to 10 seconds from 40 seconds (20 seconds for minion spell shards).**

**Zoe can only hold a spell shard for 10 seconds down from 60 seconds.**

**Only champions and large minions can drop spell shards.**

**Number of orbs increased to 5 from 3.**

**Damage per Orb decreased to 10 / 20 / 30 / 40 / 50 (+ 10% AP) from 25 / 35 / 45 / 55 / 65 (+ 18.3% AP).**

**Total magic damage changed to 50 / 100 / 150 / 200 / 250 (+ 50% AP) from 75 / 105 / 135 / 165 / 195 (+ 55% AP).**

**Orb duration decreased to 5 seconds from 10 seconds.**

**Bonus movement speed decreased to 30 / 35 / 40 / 45 / 50% from 30 / 40 / 50 / 60 / 70%.**
I could agree with that. When I see a Zoe get an ignite drop, I have to sit by turret and give up the CS until the ignite wears off.

I feel it would help if she could only steal drops from other champions, including perhaps allies. She might need buffs in compensation, but at least it would allow her to access the full range of summoner spells and items without requiring her to have even more under-the-hood RNG work done to make her less frustrating in lane.

Without the minion drops, they would need to increase the damage on her other abilities. 

And then people would just go back to complaining that they're getting one-shot by her instead. 

That, or she would be left in the same sorry state as Nidalee and Ryze with absolutely no precedence, considering unlike them she's never dominated even one role.

Damage is but one of the possible means of buffing her, and is by no means the only one. Personally, assuming some other tweaks were also in place, I'd support reducing the cooldown on her blink, or even increasing its range, so that she can use it more freely.

It's not a movement ability. It puts her right back where she started, so it's impossible to use it to run or reposition. 

That would do literally nothing unless they also buffed the Q's damage based on range.

Considering that she is a damage mage and not a support, increasing her damage is the only way of buffing her unless you want to reduce the cooldown on her Q to Swain's level.

> [{quoted}](name=Uber Deer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=onJsxYIA,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-07T10:16:03.850+0000)

> It's not a movement ability. It puts her right back where she started, so it's impossible to use it to run or reposition. 

At literally no point did I mention that her blink was some repositioning effect, or any similar kind of mobility. Is it just some learned reflex to automatically produce that line whenever someone mentions Zoe's blink? By the way, she has a blink. It's not repositioning, but it does stuff for her.

> [{quoted}](name=Uber Deer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=onJsxYIA,comment-id=0006000000000000,timestamp=2018-08-07T10:16:03.850+0000)
> 
> That would do literally nothing unless they also buffed the Q's damage based on range.

This is patently not true, since the blink serves to increase the range on all of Zoe's abilities. This includes her Q, but also would provide more opportunities to use her passive, as well as pop around in situations that don't just involve her Q. Effectively, lowering the cooldown could make her more versatile, and increasing the range would increase her Q effective range by extension as well.
